channel.title: rstudio on :fish: Fishy Data
channel.description: Recent content in rstudio on :fish: Fishy Data

item.title: Little productivity boosters - Alfred + .Rproj
item.description: The problem If you are opening and closing a lot of RStudio projects throughout the day, it’s useful to think about the most efficient way to search for and open .Rproj files. I want to avoid using my mouse in a Finder window and I find that the default Mac search app Spotlight provides too many results. The solution I came across this tip by Hadley Wickham that makes use of the Alfred app1.

item.title: Little productivity boosters - git alias
item.description: The problem For years I have staged, committed and pushed changes with the RStudio Git interface. It works! But it can be time-consuming when you are doing it a lot. And I’ve been trying to use my mouse less. It would be better to do this in the terminal. The solution I found this solution on stackoverflow, which suggests staging and committing all files by running the following in the terminal:
